de.dipf.edutec.thriller.experiencesampling.sensorservice

Class AccountConnector

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.dipf.edutec.thriller.experiencesampling.sensorservice.AccountConnector

  • public class AccountConnector
extends Object
    Provides methods to connect to the MQTT broker through MqttService with automatic redirect to login or settings page. AccountManager is used to manage the authentication process and store login credentials.
    See Also:
    MqttService, AccountManager, AbstractAccountAuthenticator, AccountAuthenticatorActivity

    • Method Detail

      • connect

        public static boolean connect(Context ctx,
                              boolean isFlagNew,
                              boolean checkLoginOnly,
                              boolean redirect,
                              MqttService mqttService)

        Connects the client to the MQTT broker using credentials from AccountManager. Redirects automatically to account creation or modification if credentials do not exist or are invalid. Moreover redirects to settings page if necessary settings to connect are not found in SharedPreferences.

        Account and credential management is outsourced exclusively to AccountManager. If no accounts are found for the appropriate account type, the user is redirected through AccountManager.addAccount(String, String, String[], Bundle, Activity, AccountManagerCallback, Handler). The corresponding logic to add an account is implemented in AccountAuthenticator.addAccount(AccountAuthenticatorResponse, String, String, String[], Bundle). If login credentials are invalid, the process is continued by AccountAuthenticator.updateCredentials(AccountAuthenticatorResponse, Account, String, Bundle).

        Parameters:
        ctx - Context in which the connect logic should take place.
        isFlagNew - Start the account management activity with Intent.FLAG_ACTIVITY_NEW_TASK.
        checkLoginOnly - Established a connection to the MQTT broker after login.
        redirect - Enable automatic redirect to the account management activity if login fails.
        mqttService - Service to login and connect to the MQTT broker.
        Returns:
        True if connection and login was successful, false if not.

      • checkPortAndHost

        public static boolean checkPortAndHost(Context ctx,
                                       boolean isFlagNew,
                                       Context applicationContext,
                                       boolean badHost,
                                       boolean badPort,
                                       boolean isEmpty)
        Redirects to SettingsActivity if host and port configuration is incomplete.
        Parameters:
        ctx - Context in which the SettingsActivity shall be launched.
        isFlagNew - Start the SettingsActivity with Intent.FLAG_ACTIVITY_NEW_TASK.
        applicationContext - Application context in which the SettingsActivity shall be launched.
        badHost - Host parameter is invalid.
        badPort - Port parameter is invalid.
        isEmpty - Parameters are invalid because they are empty.
        Returns:
        True if badHost and badPort are true, false if not.
